review: I have had my Amazon TV hooked up since Christmas 2014. But, I have one very major complaint. Although I pay for movies sometimes, I feel cheated when I pay for a movie that I could have watched free. How does this happen, you ask? Well when a movie is free on HBO Go, Amazon TV has a nice little check box stating" watch now for free with HBO Go" (a free app available on Amazon TV if you subscribe to HBO with your cable co). However if that same movie is available on Netflix (which also requires a subscription) another free app available on Amazon TV, there is no check box and Amazon will just charge you to rent or buy the movie instead.Now, after reading a bit about this issue, I find that Amazon and Netflix are having a petty squabble about money (pfft what a shock) but, as a consumer, that is not my problem and I find it extremely unfair for Amazon to cheat me out of my hard earned money to rent a movie that I could have watched for free.FIX THIS AMAZON!

review: I agree with  other reviewers that Fire TV seems cold. It is fast but it is also a sales tool for Amazon, everything points you to Amazon services. I have many DVDs that came with Digital Content codes for use with VUDU and / or Flixster; so far I have been unable to load the these apps on my Fire TV. This is a real issue for me as I don't wish to purchase all of the titles again on Amazon. I understand  that VUDU and Flixster are competitors with Amazon, however they bill Fire TV as a Streaming player so I think they should allow competitor's sites access. I will be looking forward to the Roku 4 release.
